diving_spots.name: Sipadan Island
diving_spots.description: One of the world's top dive spots, known for its rich marine biodiversity.

diving_spots.name: Mabul Island
diving_spots.description: Famous for muck diving and macro marine life photography.

diving_spots.name: Kapalai Island
diving_spots.description: A sandbar with a resort, known for beautiful reefs and crystal-clear waters.

diving_spots.name: Layang-Layang Island
diving_spots.description: Remote atoll, famous for hammerhead sharks and pristine reefs.

diving_spots.name: Redang Island
diving_spots.description: Offers vibrant coral reefs and clear waters, ideal for beginners.

diving_spots.name: Perhentian Islands
diving_spots.description: Popular for snorkeling and scuba diving with vibrant marine life.

diving_spots.name: Tioman Island
diving_spots.description: A marine park with diverse coral reefs and large fish species.

diving_spots.name: Tenggol Island
diving_spots.description: Known for whale shark sightings during the migration season.

diving_spots.name: Mataking Island
diving_spots.description: Offers stunning underwater landscapes, coral gardens, and unique wreck dives.

diving_spots.name: Pom Pom Island
diving_spots.description: A secluded paradise with abundant marine life and coral reefs.

diving_spots.name: Lankayan Island
diving_spots.description: Remote island with spectacular coral reefs and rare critters.

diving_spots.name: Aur Island
diving_spots.description: Popular among experienced divers, known for deep-water diving.

diving_spots.name: Lang Tengah Island
diving_spots.description: Quiet island between Redang and Perhentian, with beautiful dive sites.
